intro: Themistoclesia diminuta, commonly known as the dwarf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its small, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or violet. The plant is native to tropical regions of the Americas and thrives in warm, humid climates. Its vines grow rapidly, often climbing or trailing along supports. The leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
